etymology: Slavic origin word. Related to other South Slavic languages
cultural_note: Bulgarian cuisine diverse, influenced by Ottoman, Greek, and Slavic traditions
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Хляб' ≈ 'Brot'. Bulgarisches Wort. Häufig verwendet.
notes_bg_to_de: 'Das Brot' е среден род; множествено 'die Brote'. Типичен израз: 'ein frisches Brot kaufen'.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian word at word level. Pay attention to stress and pronunciation

etymology: Slavic origin word. Related to other South Slavic languages
cultural_note: Bulgarian cuisine diverse, influenced by Ottoman, Greek, and Slavic traditions
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Мляко' ≈ 'Milch'. Bulgarisches Wort. Häufig verwendet.
notes_bg_to_de: 'Die Milch' е необроимо; при видове се използва прилагателно: 'die Vollmilch', 'die Mandelmilch'.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian word at word level. Pay attention to stress and pronunciation

etymology: Slavic origin word. Related to other South Slavic languages
cultural_note: Bulgarian cuisine diverse, influenced by Ottoman, Greek, and Slavic traditions
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Сирене' ≈ 'Käse'. Bulgarisches Wort. Häufig verwendet.
notes_bg_to_de: 'Der Käse' е мъжки род; множествено рядко ('die Käse', 'die Käsesorten'). Израз: 'ein Stück Käse'.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian word at word level. Pay attention to stress and pronunciation

etymology: Slavic origin word. Related to other South Slavic languages
cultural_note: Bulgarian cuisine diverse, influenced by Ottoman, Greek, and Slavic traditions
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Месо' ≈ 'Fleisch'. Bulgarisches Wort. Häufig verwendet.
notes_bg_to_de: 'Das Fleisch' е неизброимо: 'Rindfleisch', 'Schweinefleisch'. Използва се и в израза 'kein Fleisch essen'.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian word at word level. Pay attention to stress and pronunciation

etymology: Slavic origin word. Related to other South Slavic languages
cultural_note: Bulgarian cuisine diverse, influenced by Ottoman, Greek, and Slavic traditions
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Риба' ≈ 'Fisch'. Bulgarisches Wort. Häufig verwendet.
notes_bg_to_de: 'Der Fisch' обозначава и рибата като храна, и животното. Множествено: 'die Fische'.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian word at word level. Pay attention to stress and pronunciation

etymology: Slavic origin word. Related to other South Slavic languages
cultural_note: Bulgarian cuisine diverse, influenced by Ottoman, Greek, and Slavic traditions
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Зеленчуци' ≈ 'Gemüse'. Bulgarisches Wort. Häufig verwendet.
notes_bg_to_de: 'Das Gemüse' е колективно и няма множествено число. Пример: 'frisches Gemüse kaufen'.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian word at word level. Pay attention to stress and pronunciation

etymology: Slavic origin word. Related to other South Slavic languages
cultural_note: Bulgarian cuisine diverse, influenced by Ottoman, Greek, and Slavic traditions
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Плодове' ≈ 'Obst'. Bulgarisches Wort. Häufig verwendet.
notes_bg_to_de: 'Das Obst' също е колективно; за различни видове се казва 'verschiedenes Obst' или 'Obstsorten'.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian word at word level. Pay attention to stress and pronunciation

etymology: Slavic origin word. Related to other South Slavic languages
cultural_note: Bulgarian cuisine diverse, influenced by Ottoman, Greek, and Slavic traditions
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Сок' ≈ 'Saft'. Bulgarisches Wort. Häufig verwendet.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian word at word level. Pay attention to stress and pronunciation

etymology: Slavic origin word. Related to other South Slavic languages
cultural_note: Bulgarian cuisine diverse, influenced by Ottoman, Greek, and Slavic traditions
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Кафе' ≈ 'Kaffee'. Bulgarisches Wort. Häufig verwendet.
notes_bg_to_de: 'Der Kaffee' е мъжки род; напитката: 'eine Tasse Kaffee'. За кафене се използва 'das Café'.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian word at word level. Pay attention to stress and pronunciation
